Given the broad antiviral activity of favipiravir, we also evaluated in vitro its efficacy against Zika and Marburg viruses and reported antiviral EC 50 of 6.5 and 6.8 µg/mL, respectively.

8 Interestingly these levels are markedly 2–10 times lower than what has been reported for EBOV,
31 suggesting that favipiravir could also be relevant against these pathogens.
